diff_hunk:
@@ -1855,6 +1855,14 @@ def test_index(self):
         self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: reference[1, 1, 1, 1:1])
         self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: reference[3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3])
 
+        self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: reference[0.0])
+        self.assertRaises(TypeError,    lambda: reference[0.0:2.0])
body: So how is it even possible all the cases below don't give a `TypeError` as well? You're also constructing slices from floats? Or is constructing ok, but it fails only once you use it in C?
